I often find myself consecutively filtering with multiple chained greps

grep a input | grep b | grep -v c | grep d

and found it was easier & cleaner to do in one awk expression

awk '/a/ && /b/ && !/c/ && /d/' input

Just in case someone else finds it useful.

But just like open source eats software, decentralization will eat data (maybe via a common data storage model where users authorize individual applications).

As soon as a quality decentralized alternative to e.g. FB emerges, the narrative will change and blockchain will win.

1084810500029014017.text:
Consider Facebook.

Its data centralization is what makes its AI and recommendations so good.

Consumers won’t turn to a decentralized alternative because its AI will be comparatively awful (and the case for privacy is never really strong enough).
